Docs.summary: Core class that provides access to the motion services in iOS.

remarks.para: Core Motion was introduced in iOS 7 and is not available on all devices (the iPhone 5S was the first phone to have the necessary coprocessor and the iPad Air 2 was the first tablet). Developers can check if Core Motion is available with .
Applications that wish to access Core Motion must have an entitlements.plist file.

Users must explicitly grant access to Core Motion via a standard privacy dialog. Unlike most functions that require user permissions, there is not a corresponding API to check status.
